title: Kevin Maguire: Jeremy Corbyn can triumph over big-gun Boris Johnson
text:

Liars create the illusion of truth and Boris Johnson repeats his fibs so often he has convinced the gullible they’re actually true.

The most deceitful Prime Minister in living memory is orchestrating a giant con job, chanting his “Get Brexit Done” manta with the dishonesty of an immoral fraudster who doesn’t know right from wrong.

Apply to politics the legal, decent, honest and truthful tests applied by the Advertising Standards Authority to traders flogging blueberries or pet insurance and Johnson would be fined a packet.

Brexit is far more likely to be an expensive calamity than the gift he pretends, yet Johnson’s immediate dishonesty is maintaining that Britain will be out of Europe on Hallo­­ween, without explaining how.

Theresa May declared 108 times we’d be out by March 29 this year, so maybe he’s going for her record before conceding an October 31 defeat.

(Image: Ian Vogler / Daily Mirror)

Labour and opposition parties striving to take back control of Parliament to ensure the tinpot tyrant obeys the law doesn’t distract from an uncomfortable truth – lying all of the time to some of the people is working for the Fake News PM.

The 15% lead for the Tories in a weekend opinion poll has rattled Labour MPs, who fear reason has gone out of the window.

Jeremy Corbyn at times ­resembles Tank Man, the Chinese protester who so courageously stood his ground in front of a ­military column in Tiananmen Square 30 years ago.

That heroic protest was applauded by progressives everywhere but it didn’t halt a repressive regime which then tightened its grip.

(Image: MDM)

Corbyn’s praetorians, who cite a 2017 poll which put Labour 24 points behind before finishing tantalisingly close to winning, are old generals fighting the last war.

A path to victory does exist for Labour if Corbyn focuses public attention on his party’s attractive policies and the terrible truths about the Tories and exposes the grim reality of ­Johnson’s Brexit scam.

None of that is happening at the moment and I’ve heard left-wing MPs loyal to Corbyn fretting as loudly as anyone that when the election comes it may end with Britain’s Trump mini-me still in Downing Street.

Johnson lying his way to victory would be Corbyn’s nightmare.
